name: Deepwood Dweller's Ingenuity
description: This firm rack of bottles and reagents is made to store plant extracts. Sometimes, the contents within some of these samples alone may paint much of the picture of a region's ecological conditions.\nWhen investigating the ecology of different areas, the use of cutting-edge technologies can result in more gain for less pain. Of course, what counts as "acceptable conditions" for data collection is something that learned Forest Rangers and Watchers need to figure out.
